name: Armenia
description: It can get oppressively hot in the cities and lowlands.

name: Austria
description: School holidays begin in July, the time when families enjoy the warm weather on lakes and in the mountains. Cities can be sweltering and crowded, but restaurant dining is at its alfresco best.

name: Azerbaijan
description: It can get oppressively hot in the cities and lowlands but this is a great time to head to the mountains or the seaside.

name: Congo, the Democratic Republic of the
Croatia
description: Tourist season is in full swing: hotels along the coast get booked out and beaches are full. Ferries run on their maximum schedule and there are festivals aplenty. Head inland to escape the coastal crowds.

name: Czech Republic
description: Most of the country swelters in summer, so pack some lightweight clothes and opt for accommodation with air-conditioning.

name: Denmark
description: Many Danes take their main work holiday during the first three weeks of July, so expect busy seaside resorts, chock-a-block camping grounds and near-full coastal hotels - book ahead to join in on the beachy summer-holiday vibe.

name: Estonia
description: Summer is in full swing as locals gather on terraces and verandahs during the week to sip mugs of beer alfresco. On the weekends everyone flees the cities for their countryside abodes.

name: Finland
description: Peak season sees long, long days and sunshine. Finland really comes to life, with festivals throughout, boat trips, activities, cheaper hotels and a celebratory feel. Insects in many areas are a nuisance.

name: France
description: If lavender's your French love, now is the time to catch it flowering in Provence. But you won't be the only one. School's out for the summer, showering the country with tourists, traffic and too many complet (full) signs strung in hotel windows.

name: Georgia
description: It can get oppressively hot in the cities and lowlands but this is a great time to head to the mountains or the seaside.

name: Germany
description: School's out for the summer and peak travelling season begins. Pre-book accommodation whether you're headed to the mountains or the coast. Swimming is now possible in lakes, rivers, and the Baltic and North seas.

name: Greece
description: Guaranteed sunshine as temperatures soar and life buzzes on the islands' beaches. Outdoor cinemas and giant beach clubs draw visitors to Athens' nightlife.

name: Ireland
description: There isn't a weekend in the month that a major festival doesn't take place, while visitors to Galway will find that the city is in full swing for the entire month.

name: Italy
description: School is out and Italians head away from the cities and to mountains or beaches for summer holidays. Prices and temperatures rise. Many cities host summer art festivals.

name: Latvia
description: Summer is in full swing as locals gather on terraces and verandahs during the week to sip mugs of beer alfresco. On the weekends everyone flees the cities for their countryside abodes.

name: Lithuania
description: Summer is in full swing as locals gather on terraces and verandahs during the week to sip mugs of beer alfresco. On the weekends everyone flees the cities for their countryside abodes.

name: Netherlands
description: The days are long, the sun is shining, beaches get busy and outdoor cafés are mobbed with locals and tourists alike. Nobody wants to be inside.

name: Norway
description: July is the peak tourist season throughout most of Norway, with the year's best weather and cheapest prices for hotels. Tourist sights can be crowded and we strongly recommend advance reservations for accommodation.

name: Poland
description: July can be hot and sunny or cold and rainy, depending on your luck. Resorts are crowded, but not as bad as they will be in August. The festival season kicks into high gear.

name: Portugal
description: The summer heat arrives, bringing sunseekers who pack the Algarve resorts. Lisbon and Porto also swell with crowds, and prices peak in July and August.

name: Romania
description: The summer sun starts to boil. Bucharest and other large cities are often unbearable as temperatures can top 40°C. Locals hit the beaches on the Black Sea for relief.

name: Slovenia
description: Mostly warm and sunny, July is a big month for festivals. Nearly every village and town has something going on. Trekkers, watch out for freak storms in higher elevations.

name: South Georgia and the South Sandwich Islands
Spain
description: Temperatures in Andalucía and much of the interior can be fiercely hot, but July is a great time to be at the beach and is one of the best months for hiking in the Pyrenees.

name: Sweden
description: July is peak summer-tourism season: the weather is fine, attractions are open and everyone is cheerful. Many Swedes (especially in larger cities) go on holiday, though, and lots of shops and restaurants are closed for vacation.

name: Switzerland
description: The month of music: days are hot and sun-filled, and lake shores and Alpine meadows double as perfect summer stages for Swiss yodellers, alpenhorn players and flag throwers.

name: Turkey
description: This month and August turn the Aegean and Mediterranean tourist heartlands into sun-and-fun machines, and temperatures peak across the country. The blue skies bring out the best in the Turkish personality.

name: Ukraine
description: Alas, most visitors arrive in the hottest months of the year when travel becomes a sweaty ordeal. Give the big cities a wide berth at this time of year and head for the cooler Carpathians.

name: United Kingdom
description: Proper summer. Festivals every week. School summer breaks begin, so there's a holiday tingle in the air, dulled only by busy roads on Fridays, because everyone's going somewhere for the weekend.
